data.title: Going Into Semifinals, U.C.L.A. Is Hurting
data.meta_description: UCLA men's basketball team prepares to face Louisian
data.text:
INDIANAPOLIS, March 31 - U.C.L.A. will play Louisiana State in an N.C.A.A. semifinal Saturday with two big men hurt. Ryan Hollins, the Bruins' 7-foot-1 center, bruised his right thigh during practice Friday.

Lorenzo Mata, their 6-8 center, broke his nose earlier in the week.

Hollins, a senior, was to receive electrical stimulation, massage and ice therapy on the thigh, Coach Ben Howland said.

"He has some swelling there," Howland said. "Assuming it's just musculature, it will take a team of horses to hold him from being able to play. Anything's possible, though, especially this year."

Hollins was hurt in a collision with a teammate during a practice before the Bruins arrived at the RCA Dome for a shoot-around, which Hollins sat out. In the tournament, Hollins has averaged 12 points, second on the team, and 6.3 rebounds.

Mata practiced Friday with a mask after breaking his nose in practice Wednesday. "Our trainer did a good job of snapping it right back into place," Howland said. Mata also broke his nose in January.

THE DAVIS AND NOAH SHOW -- Short news conferences before big sports events do not necessarily reveal character or even dimensions of personality. But they sometimes hint at an athlete's state of mind.
